intro: Tetrapterys complicata, commonly known as the Brazilian nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive net-like venation pattern. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Tetrapterys complicata is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
